storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view a calendar showing resource availability to avoid scheduling conflicts

testCases.title: Verify calendar displays accurate resource availability
preconditions: User has valid scheduler credentials and is logged into the system
At least one resource exists in the system with scheduled appointments
Resource scheduling database contains both booked and free time slots
Network connection is stable and meets standard requirements
User has appropriate permissions to view resource availability calendar

steps.action: Navigate to the resource availability calendar section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Calendar interface loads and displays within 2 seconds showing the current month view with resource availability grid

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the resource dropdown or list
steps.expectedResult: Calendar refreshes and displays the selected resource's schedule with clearly distinguished booked slots (marked/colored) and free slots (unmarked/different color) for the current time period

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of displayed time slots by comparing with known scheduled appointments
steps.expectedResult: All booked time slots match existing appointments in the system, and free slots are correctly shown as available

steps.action: Using a separate session or admin panel, create a new appointment for the selected resource or modify an existing schedule
steps.expectedResult: External schedule change is successfully saved in the system

steps.action: Return to the calendar view and observe the resource availability display without manually refreshing
steps.expectedResult: Calendar automatically updates in real-time to reflect the new booking or schedule change, showing the previously free slot as now booked or vice versa

postconditions: Calendar displays current and accurate resource availability
Real-time updates are functioning correctly
No system errors or performance issues occurred
User session remains active and stable

testCases.title: Test filtering by resource type
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler privileges
Resource availability calendar is accessible
Multiple resource types exist in the system (e.g., Conference Rooms, Equipment, Personnel)
Each resource type has at least one resource with scheduled availability
Calendar view is already loaded and displaying all resources

steps.action: Locate and click on the resource type filter dropdown or filter panel on the calendar interface
steps.expectedResult: Filter options panel opens displaying all available resource types as selectable options

steps.action: Select a specific resource type from the filter options (e.g., 'Conference Rooms')
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied successfully and calendar view refreshes to display only resources belonging to the selected type

steps.action: Verify that only the filtered resource type is visible by checking resource names and availability slots
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows only resources of the selected type with their respective booked and free slots; resources of other types are hidden from view

steps.action: Click the remove filter button, clear filter option, or deselect the resource type filter
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed and calendar view refreshes to display all resource types and their availability

steps.action: Verify that all resources across all types are now visible in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Calendar displays complete resource availability for all resource types with accurate booked and free time slots

postconditions: Calendar is displaying all resources without any active filters
Filter functionality is working correctly
No data loss or display errors occurred during filtering operations
System performance remained within acceptable limits

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to override scheduling conflicts with authorization to handle exceptional cases

testCases.title: Validate authorized override of scheduling conflict
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler role
User has valid authorization credentials for override functionality
A scheduling conflict scenario exists (overlapping resource booking or time slot conflict)
Audit logging system is active and functioning
Override feature is enabled in the system configuration

steps.action: Attempt to create or modify a schedule that triggers a scheduling conflict with an existing appointment
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict alert message with details of the conflicting schedules

steps.action: Click on the 'Override' or 'Override Conflict' button displayed in the conflict alert dialog
steps.expectedResult: System displays an authorization prompt requesting credentials (username/password or additional authentication) for override approval

steps.action: Enter valid authorization credentials in the authentication fields and submit
steps.expectedResult: System validates the credentials within 2 seconds and displays a success message indicating override has been applied

steps.action: Verify that the conflicting schedule has been successfully created or modified despite the conflict
steps.expectedResult: The new or modified schedule is saved in the system and appears in the calendar view, overriding the previous conflict restriction

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs or override history section of the system
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads and displays recent system activities

steps.action: Search for or filter the override action that was just performed using timestamp or user filters
steps.expectedResult: Override entry is present in the audit logs with correct user identity, timestamp, conflict details, and override action recorded

postconditions: Scheduling conflict has been successfully overridden
Override action is permanently logged in audit trail
System remains stable with no errors
Conflicting schedules are both active in the system
User session remains authenticated

testCases.title: Verify prevention of unauthorized override
preconditions: User is logged into the system with scheduler role
A scheduling conflict scenario exists in the system
User has invalid or no override authorization credentials
Security and authentication systems are functioning properly
Override attempt logging is enabled

steps.action: Attempt to create or modify a schedule that triggers a scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict alert with override option available

steps.action: Click on the 'Override' button in the conflict alert dialog
steps.expectedResult: System displays authorization prompt requesting credentials for override approval

steps.action: Enter invalid authorization credentials (incorrect username, password, or unauthorized user credentials) and submit
steps.expectedResult: System denies the override request within 2 seconds and displays an error message such as 'Invalid credentials' or 'Unauthorized access'

steps.action: Verify that the scheduling conflict remains unresolved and the conflicting schedule was not created or modified
steps.expectedResult: Original conflict restriction remains in place; no new schedule is saved; calendar shows no changes

steps.action: Close the authorization prompt and click the override button again
steps.expectedResult: System displays the authorization prompt again

steps.action: Click cancel or close the authorization prompt without entering any credentials
steps.expectedResult: System denies the override attempt, closes the authorization dialog, and returns to the conflict alert screen without applying any override

steps.action: Verify the conflict alert is still displayed and the schedule remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert remains visible; no schedule changes were saved; system maintains data integrity

postconditions: Scheduling conflict remains unresolved and enforced
No unauthorized override was applied
System security measures functioned correctly
Failed override attempts may be logged for security monitoring
User session remains active without lockout (unless security policy dictates otherwise)

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to provide a dashboard summarizing scheduling conflicts and alerts for quick overview

testCases.title: Verify dashboard displays current conflicts and alerts
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with dashboard access permissions
User is logged into the system
Active scheduling conflicts exist in the system
Alerts have been generated and are in various acknowledgment states
Standard network connection is available (minimum bandwidth requirements met)
Test data includes at least 5 active conflicts and 10 alerts with mixed statuses

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling dashboard URL or click on the Dashboard menu item
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page begins loading and displays loading indicator

steps.action: Measure the time from navigation initiation to complete dashboard render
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely within 3 seconds, displaying all UI components including conflict counts, alert statuses, and data tables

steps.action: Review the conflict count displayed on the dashboard summary section
steps.expectedResult: Conflict count matches the actual number of active conflicts in the system (verify against database or admin panel)

steps.action: Review the alert statuses section showing acknowledged vs unacknowledged alerts
steps.expectedResult: Alert acknowledgment statuses are displayed correctly with accurate counts for each status category (acknowledged, pending, unacknowledged)

steps.action: Verify the details of displayed conflicts including conflict type, affected resources, and timestamps
steps.expectedResult: All conflict details are accurate, complete, and match the source data with current timestamps

steps.action: Check the real-time update functionality by creating a new conflict in another session or having another user create one
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically updates within 5 seconds to reflect the new conflict without requiring manual refresh

steps.action: Apply a filter to show only high-priority conflicts using the filter dropdown or checkbox options
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard immediately updates to display only high-priority conflicts, with conflict count adjusting accordingly

steps.action: Apply a filter to show only unacknowledged alerts
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard filters the alert list to show only unacknowledged alerts, updating the visible count

steps.action: Sort the conflicts list by date in ascending order by clicking the date column header
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered with oldest conflicts appearing first, sort indicator shows ascending order

steps.action: Sort the conflicts list by date in descending order by clicking the date column header again
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered with newest conflicts appearing first, sort indicator shows descending order

steps.action: Sort the alerts by acknowledgment status
steps.expectedResult: Alerts are grouped and sorted by status (e.g., unacknowledged first, then acknowledged), maintaining data accuracy

steps.action: Clear all applied filters using the 'Clear Filters' or 'Reset' button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard returns to default view showing all conflicts and alerts with original sorting

steps.action: Verify the data accuracy by comparing displayed metrics with backend data source
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard data shows 95% or higher accuracy when compared to actual conflict and alert logs

postconditions: Dashboard remains in functional state with all filters and sorting options available
No errors or warnings are displayed in the UI or browser console
User session remains active and authenticated
Dashboard data reflects the most current state of conflicts and alerts
All applied filters and sorting can be cleared to return to default view
